title: Cervera Mountains
text:
The Cervera Mountains () is an long mountain range in the <a href="Baix%20Maestrat">Baix Maestrat</a> comarca, <a href="Valencian%20Community">Valencian Community</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. In some ancient texts these mountains are known as Serra d'en Menor. Its highest point is <a href="Revoltons">Revoltons</a>, . Other notable summits are Perdiguera, and Mola, .
Location.
The Cervera Mountains rise north of the <a href="Cervera%20del%20Maestrat">Cervera del Maestrat</a> town, south of <a href="Traiguera">Traiguera</a> and east of <a href="La%20Jana">La Jana</a>. They are located in the transitional zone between the <a href="Mediterranean%20climate">Mediterranean</a> and the <a href="continental%20climate">continental climate</a>. In the winter the weather is colder than in the coastal mountain ranges and the summits are often covered in <a href="snow">snow</a> for a few days after each snowstorm.
The Our Lady of health shrine "(Reial Santuari de Nostra Senyora de la Font de la Salut)" which was first built in the 14th century is located on the eastern side of these mountains.
The mountains are mostly covered with <a href="Mediterranean%20forests%2C%20woodlands%2C%20and%20scrub">Mediterranean</a> <a href="Maquis%20shrubland">Maquis shrubland</a>. There are some patches of <a href="pine">pine</a> forest.
